question: The "Monument to the Divine Saviour of the World" is an important landmark of which country?
explanation: Monument to the Divine Saviour of the World is located in the Saviour of the World Plaza region in the San Salvador city of El Salvador. It is a landmark located in the country's capital San Salvador. It is a symbol that identifies and represents both El Salvador and Salvadorans throughout the world. The monument is composed of a tall, four-sided concrete base pedestal that supports a statue of Jesus Christ standing on top of planet earth. The structure was designed by José María Villaseñor.
